title: Smoke Signals Barbecue Sauce
ingredients: 3 large garlic cloves, peeled and minced
1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes with added purée
1 (12-ounce) bottle amber beer, such as Dos Equis
¼ cup packed light brown sugar
3 tablespoons adobo from the chipotle can
½ teaspoon liquid hickory smoke flavoring
instructions: In a heavy 3-quart saucepan, over low heat, warm the olive oil.  When the oil is hot add the onions and the garlic and cook, covered, stirring once or twice, for 10 minutes.  Stir in the chili powder blend and cook, covered, for 5 more minutes.

Stir in the crushed tomatoes, the beer, salsa, catsup, brown sugar, chipotles, adobo, vinegar, molasses, liquid smoke, and the salt.  Stir the mixture and bring it to a simmer.  Cook, partially covered, stirring once or twice, until the sauce has thickened slightly and is shiny; about 30 minutes at a simmer setting.
Cool the sauce to room temperature and purée the mixture in a blender.  Transfer the sauce to a storage container and refrigerate.
remarks: The sauce will keep for several weeks in the refrigerator or can be transferred to a number of containers and frozen for up to 3 months.
source: The El Paso Chile Company’s Texas Border Cookbook, by W. Park Kerr and Norma Kerr, published by William Morrow and Co., Inc., New York, © 1992 by W. Park Kerr and Norma Kerr and Michael McLaughlin.
